subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – rice kernels.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
; “uncooked rice; husked seed; etc.”
: From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*ma-j ~ mej||rice; paddy}}. Cognate with {{cog|grt|mi}}, {{cog|aot|mai}}.
; “metre”
: {{zh-etym-short|米突}}, from {{der|zh|en|metre}}.

subSections.title: Kanji
Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wp|lang=ja}} {{wp|Rice}}
{{ja-kanjitab|こめ|yomi=k}} {{IPAfont|⟨ko2me2⟩}} → *{{IPAchar|/kəməj/}} → {{IPAchar|/kome/}} From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=こめ|-}}. Many theories exist regarding the ultimate derivation: * From {{ja-l||籠め|kome}}, the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||stem or continuative form}} of verb {{m|ja|籠める|tr=komeru||do with one's heart}}, from the way rice is farmed. * From {{bor|ja|map-pro|*Səmay||cooked rice}}.[[w:Laurent Sagart|Sagart, Laurent]] (2011). "[https://hal.archives-ouvertes.fr/hal-00651427/document How many independent rice vocabularies in Asia?]". In: Sanchez-Mazas, A.; Blench, R.; Ross, M. et al. (eds.), ''Rice and Language Across Asia: Crops, Movement, and Social Change''. New York: Routledge, 1-32.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|y=k|こめ|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR,SMK2,ZAJ}}

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
Proverbs
Coordinate terms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|五%穀|ご%こく|five grains}}: {{ja-r|米|こめ|rice}}, {{ja-r|麦|むぎ|[[wheat]]}}, {{ja-r|粟|あわ|[[foxtail millet]]}}, {{ja-r|黍|きび|[[proso millet]]}}, {{ja-r|豆|まめ|[[soybean]]s}}

subSections.title: See also
Proper noun
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|よね|yomi=k}}
{{IPAfont|⟨yo<sub>2</sub>nai⟩}} → *{{IPAchar|/jənai/}} → *{{IPAchar|/jəne/}} → {{IPAchar|/jone/}}

First attested in the ''{{w|Wamyō Ruijushō}}'' (938 {{CE}}).

Possibly from {{inh|ja|jpx-pro||*jənaC-}} (Vovin, 1998)<ref>Whitman, John (2012). "[https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s12284-011-9080-0 Northeast Asian Linguistic Ecology and the Advent of Rice Agriculture in Korea and Japan], ''Rice'', Volume 4, Issue 3–4, pp 149–158. https://doi.org/10.1007/s12284-011-9080-0</ref> and related to {{m|ja|稲|tr=ine||[[rice]] [[plant]]}}. 

Unknown "-C-" consonantal "stem", reconstructed by Vovin, seems unlikely considering {{IPAfont|[a ~ e]}} vowel alternation:
:Compare {{m|ja|藍|tr=awi → ai||indigo}} from {{m|ja|青|tr=awo → ao||[[blue]]}} + {{m|ja|い|tr=i|pos=emphatic nominative particle}}<ref>Thomas Pellard (2013).  [https://hal.archives-ouvertes.fr/hal-01289288/document Ryukyuan perspectives on the proto-Japonic vowel system].  Frellesvig, Bjarke; Sells, Peter. Japanese/Korean Linguistics 20, CSLI Publications, pp.81–96, 2013.</ref> against {{m|ja|白い}} {{IPAfont|/siroi/}} from {{IPAfont|⟨siro<sub>1</sub>ki<sub>1</sub>⟩}}.<ref>Hamano, S. "Voicing of Obstruents in Old Japanese: Evidence from the Sound-Symbolic Stratum." ''Journal of East Asian Linguistics'' (2000) 9. 3: 207-225. https://doi.org/10.1023/A:1008367619295</ref>

The colloquial sense is derived from the components of the {{ja-l||米}} kanji: {{m|ja|八|tr=hachi||[[eight]]}} + {{m|ja|十|tr=jū||[[ten]]}} + {{m|ja||八|tr=hachi|eight}}.
